sense.name: make a loud noise, as an animal
sense.examples: The mouse turned the tables and roared at the lion. A zoo visitor says man roared at a tiger. The monster roared in pain. The audience roared in laughter at the comedienne.

sense.name: proceed in a turbulent way, often accompanied by noise
sense.commentary:
Syntax Includes: NP1[theme[inanimate]] ROAR (ADVP[manner]) PP[directional] NP1[agent[animate]] ROAR (ADVP[manner]) PP[directional]
Includes: ROAR OFF
NOTE: in this sense 'roar' does not JUST refer to the sound an NP makes but also (in the case of an animate NP1) the manner in which NP1 moves.
sense.examples: The wind roared through the trees. The deparados roared down the hill on lathered horses. Johnny jumped in the car and roared off into the sunset. A winter avalanche roared towards the small village. The tornado roared all around us.

sense.name: utter words loudly and forcefully
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent[human]] ROAR (PP) NP1[agent[human]] ROAR SCOMP NOTE: Usually precedes or follows a direct quotation. When it doesn't, as in example 2, it is explicitly stated that words are being used.
sense.examples: 'Get out!' He roared at the cat. Matt roared that Mary was lazy. She roared, 'I declare this cave to be my castle!'
